column4: my printer stopped responding. If I try to cancel a job it says "CUPS server error
There was an error during the CUPS operation: 'client-error-not-possible'."
ï»¿ my printer stopped responding. If I try to cancel a job it says "CUPS server error There was an error during the CUPS operation: 'client-error-not-possible'."
switched the computer and printer off and it still says "processing" .. the printer is totally lifeless and the activity light on the printer is not flashing or anything
it was working a couple of days ago
if you switched both off, what says processing?
under system > admin > Printers and printer status
on another PC which was still on when these two were switched off?
I restarted the computer and the printer after I switched both off.
oh ok, you had me there for a moment
is it setup correctly? is CUPS working? what errors does the cups log give
I can't remember how to get to CUPS log or browser page
/var/log/cups/error_log
it won't let me open the error log.
do a sudo tail -f /var/log/cups/error_log in a terminal while you try to print
also in the CUPS browser control panel page it is asking me for a username/password for everything...
here is the tail stub of my error log - http://paste.ubuntu.com/62433/
that looks bad; what did you do just before everything stopped working?

ok - I worked out the CUPS browser control panel wants my root password. I cleared the funky print job from the queue and the printer sprang back to life... I just tried to print a 300dpi 210mmx297mm image - that is what choked it.
is everything hunky dory now?
I think so... a test page printed.
good
